title: Valley Forge National Historical Park: Girl Scout Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     For Kids     Scout Programs     Girl Scout Ranger                  Girl Scout Ranger Program          The National Park Service and Girl Scouts of the United States of America have partnered to create the Girl Scout Ranger Program. Through this program you are invited to explore the outdoors and learn about the history of national parks.      How to earn a certificate or patch    To earn a certificate, Girl Scouts must participate in any of the programs below for a minimum of 5 hours. To earn a patch, Girl Scouts must participate in any of the programs below for a minimum of 10 hours. You can also count hours spent doing educational programs or service projects at other national park sites!      How to participate      Visit the Valley Forge National Historical Park website to learn about the park. Print out a Scout Activity Sheet to keep track of your hours. Participate in the Valley Forge programs listed below. Go to the front desk at the visitor's center, turn in your Scout Activity Sheet, tell us what you learned, and receive your certificate or patch!        Valley Forge Scout Programs    Educational Programs   Attend a ranger-led walk. Listen to a talk at the Muhlenberg Brigade Huts. Watch the park film in the Theater. Listen to Washington's Leadership talk at Washington's Headquarters. Complete the Valley Forge Junior Ranger Program.  Volunteer Service Projects*   Remove invasive crayfish from Valley Creek with the Crayfish Corps. Remove invasive plants with the Weed Warriors. Apply to volunteer in any of the open positions at Valley Forge.  Special Programs    Walk the Valley Forge Historical Trail and fill out the accompanying guide. Girl Scouts are also welcome to design their own experience or project in the park that aligns with Journey work or badge activities.  *Volunteer Service Projects require a volunteer agreement form from all those volunteering, and anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Please plan accordingly and visit the Valley Forge Volunteer website for more information. Plan your trip to Valley Forge in advance!        Additional resources for information on the Girl Scout Ranger Program   Nation-wide National park Service Girl Scout Ranger Webpage National Park Service Girl Scout Ranger Frequently Asked Questions Girl Scouts of the United States of America Blog Resource Stewardship Girl Scout Ranger Program Flyer   For additional information email Cristina Ramirez or call at (610) 783-1014
